page.title: 12DOUNE NATURE TRAIL/COMMONTY
page.content: { Doune Nature Trail}is an enjoyable walk and starts from the Moray Park. It follows the route of the old railway line but now that is gone.It is good for the general public as well as naturalists because there are lots of plants and flowers and trees like elm, willow, dog rose and elder; it is surrounded mostly by forest and farmland. It is good also for bird- watchers as there are many types of birds to be seen _ chaffinches, robins, thrushes, blackbirds, blue tits, willow warblers and whitethroats. When you have gone along about halfway you can turn on to {the {Commonty Walk.}It takes you along the fringes of a coniferous wood and back to Doune via the Springbank Quarries.
